items.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18668)
items.content_html:
blm5280 - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=blm5280&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pauder

items.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Denver Homeless Out LoudAfter some warm days last week we are approaching another week of frigid temperatures. This...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280Denver Homeless Out Loud

After some warm days last week we are approaching another week of frigid temperatures. This is when the city has decided to resume sweeping unhoused community m...embers to where? to nowhere....
This will be the 10th time this same encampment is swept in the last year. Proving that sweeping people DOES NOT WORK! DOTI has planned a SWEEP for February 10 and 11, 2021 in the area of Stout Street from 22nd to Park Avenue, 22nd from Champa to California and Park Avenue. The SWEEP will begin on both days at 6:30 a.m.
Please come and support our unhoused community members at 21st, 22nd, Stout and Park as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More

items.title: “The plaintiffs here are family members of a dead young man....
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“The plaintiffs here are family members of a dead young man. Elijah McClain’s family deserves answers to the questions of why he died and whether anyone or any entity is to be held to account,” wrote U.S. Magistrate Judge N. Reid Neureiter in a Jan. 29 order.

#TheyTriedIt #JusticeForElijahMcClain

The judge said Elijah McClain's family 'deserves answers to the questions of why he died and whether anyone or any entity is to be held to account.'

9news.com

Court rejects request to pause McClain family’s civil suit against Aurora, employees

The judge said Elijah McClain's family 'deserves answers to the questions of why he died and whether anyone or any entity is to be held to account.'The judge said Elijah McClain's family 'deserves answers to the questions of why he died and whether anyone or any entity is to be held to account.'

items.title: What happened is foul but not at all surprising coming from...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

What happened is foul but not at all surprising coming from Denver Health. They were just under fire in November for retaliating against whistleblowers raising concerns about systemic racism. Tay Anderson and his mama deserve better, and the fight for an end to policing of our hospitals is far from over.
Please like, share, and comment to help amplify this injustice and call for change!
And email Patient_advocates@dhha.org to ask them what is being done to ensure that this does not happen again! #DefundThePolice #DefendBlackLife #WeKeepUsSafe #CounselorsNotCops #MedicalRacism #DenverHealth
(image description in comments)

items.title: Black Lives Matter 5280BLM 5280 Freedom School"When children attend schools that place a greater value in discipline and security than on...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280BLM 5280 Freedom School

"When children attend schools that place a greater value in discipline and security than on knowledge and intellectual development, they are attending prep scho...ols for prison." Angela Davis

The Black Lives Matter 5280 Freedom Schools is fighting to end zero-tolerance policies and for districts to hire more counselors and not cops. Black children deserve to attend schools that foster their curiosity and brilliance and values their excellence. Get involved in the Black Lives Matter at School Year of Action.

Black Lives Matter at School Year of Action Demands:
1. End zero-tolerance policies
2. Mandate Black History
3. Hire more Black teachers
4. Hire more counselors not cops

See More

items.title: Black Lives Matter 5280HuffPost Black Voices“I would love to not be in fear for my safety day in and day out.” In 2020, a record number...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280HuffPost Black Voices

“I would love to not be in fear for my safety day in and day out.” In 2020, a record number of Black transgender women were killed in the U.S., part of a horrifying pattern of hate crimes against them that has been growing.

items.title: #TrayvonMartin you should be here celebrating; surrounded by...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#TrayvonMartin you should be here celebrating; surrounded by loved ones.

We lift your name and hold you and yours in our hearts forever.

The fight continues. #JusticeForTrayvonMartin #BlackLivesMatter #BlackHistoryMonth #SayHisName

The King Center

It’s your 26th birthday.
We remember you.
We mourn. And we work.
#TrayvonMartin

items.title: Comment a 💜 if you wanna be like Dr. Alexander when you grow...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Comment a 💜 if you wanna be like Dr. Alexander when you grow up!

“She has that on-the-ground experience. She was out there with us at the protests all summer. She knows that trauma,” says Lipscomb, a friend and colleague since 2016. “But she can also apply that deeper analysis. I think that’s where the two worlds collide so beautifully in her. She knows that people are hurting, and she knows we need policy that makes space for us to heal.”

https://magazine.du.edu/keeping-the-peace/2/…

The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. She joined the Denver Police Department in 1989, became its first African American commander, then its first female captain, then its first Black female division chief. She logged the hours in the classroom too,.....

magazine.du.edu

Keeping the peace | University of Denver Magazine

The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. She joined the Denver Police Department in 1989, became its first African American commander, then its first female captain, then its first Black female division chief. She logged the hours in the classroom too,.....The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. items.title: #CallToAction Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#CallToAction Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and th...at is unacceptable.

❗️❗️❗️ Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could’ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid.

Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More

items.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
items.content_html:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
